text: Francis Henry Dumville Smythe (1873 - 1966)Grave Stone Photos was the Archdeacon of Lewes from 1929 to 1946.‘SMYTHE, Canon Francis Henry Dumville’, Who Was Who, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 1920–2016; online edn, Oxford University Press, 2014 ; online edn, April 2014 accessed 18 July 2016 Smythe was educated at Haileybury and Imperial Service College and Emmanuel College, Cambridge.Crockford's Clerical Directory, 1951-52, London, OUP, 1951 He was ordained in 1898 and held curacies at South Petherton, Bunbury and Alfrick."Alumni Cantabrigienses: A Biographical List of All Known Students, Graduates and Holders of Office at the University of Cambridge, from the Earliest Times to 1900 " Part II. 1752–1900 Vol. v. Pace – Spyers, 1953 p581 held incumbencies in Horsted Keynes, Hove and Eastbourne; and died on 8 October 1966.Obituaries The Times (London, England), Monday, Oct 10, 1966; pg. 12; Issue 56758 ==References== Category:1873 births Category:Alumni of Emmanuel College, Cambridge Category:Archdeacons of Hastings Category:1966 deaths Category:People educated at Haileybury and Imperial Service College
title: Francis Smythe (priest)
